title: Messi wants Nou Camp return to say 'good-bye'
body: Argentina and Barcelona legend Lionel Messi said on Monday he had visited the renovated Camp Nou and hoped for a return one day to say his "goodbye". Messi, 38, left the Catalan club in 2021 for Paris Saint-Germain due to the outfit's dire financial problems before moving to Inter Miami two years later. "Last night I returned to a place I deeply miss. A place where I was immensely happy, where you made me feel a thousand times like the happiest person in the world," the eight-time Ballon d'Or winner said on Instagram. "I hope one day I can return, and not just to say goodbye as a player, as I was never able to do...," the 2022 World Cup champion added.Messi scored twice on Saturday for Inter Miami to help them into the next round of the MLS Cup play-offs.
